channel.title: I need donator only shop codes!
channel.description:
hey? how do i make one shop donators? so olny donators can get in!!!
btw its 317 server codes i need...
ty for your help.....

item.title: I need donator only shop codes!
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“server868, post:19, topic:374853”][quote author=Evil_ link=topic=470817.msg3443905#msg3443905 date=1293260133]

Anyway is it possible assign true or false to a variable in Java?(In declaration)

Of course sir.

No offense Evil_ but you always help people find a way to find a way to find a way to solve their server problems lol. This is probably the first post I have seen on server help that I can follow to the point at which it actually helps.

But to OP, I would recommend making a donor zone command and just putting donor shops there. It makes your server better and you can edit the code a whole lot easier. (That’s my opinion)
Awsome could show me a very small example of a declaration with true/false assignment? I think I have never seen it before O.o

[code]
public final class SmallExample {
private boolean donator = false;

public static void main(String[] args) {
    SmallExample example = new SmallExample();
    System.out.println("Donator: " + example.isDonator());

    example.setDonator(true);
    System.out.println("Donator: " + example.isDonator());
}

public boolean isDonator() {
    return donator;
}

public void setDonator(boolean donator) {
    this.donator = donator;
}

}[/code]

[/quote]I help people, I just don’t go straight out and tell them how to do it – because if I do, they don’t learn anything, and the next time they want to do something they’ll be right back asking us to (pretty much) make it for them again.

If you just teach someone how to do something, and not do it for them, it’ll really lower their need to rely on other…

Give a man a fish, you feed him for a day…
Teach a man to fish, you feed him for a lifetime.

^ One of my favorite chinese proverbs.

I figured I would quote you to make it more confusing considering you screwed up the quoting system already lol.

In your current code there was 1 error found:
Moparscape Forums are filled with 90% of people who create an account to download a server and leech like hell. If you try to teach them, they will wait for the thread to die and then ask the same stupid ass question again.

My Theory (and you can quote this for later use):

The less posts the idiots have on these forums, the less confusion there will be. No lazy leech will actually take the time to actually try and LEARN something from RSPS coding…[/quote]

A) I didn’t fuck up the quoting system, the other guy did.
B) If you’re saying there’s an error in that program showing the guy how to use booleans, you’re sadly mistaken.
C) I don’t care how many posts they have – I’ve known first time posters that’s had computer science degrees.
D) If they do that recreate thread bullshit, I have the power to punish them.

Read full topic
item.source: I need donator only shop codes!

item.title: I need donator only shop codes!
item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:10, topic:374853”][quote author=mage4life271 link=topic=470817.msg3443002#msg3443002 date=1293199905]
hey? how do i make one shop donators? so olny donators can get in!!!

btw its 317 server codes i need…

ty for your help…

[/quote]If you don’t even know how to use boolean expressions, you should probably go ahead and navigate here and brush up on your reading.

[quote author=Dastan_ link=topic=470817.msg3443040#msg3443040 date=1293202982]

hey? how do i make one shop donators? so olny donators can get in!!!

btw its 317 server codes i need…

ty for your help…

&& donator == 1){

[/quote]Why would you use an integer for a value that can only have the values true or false?

To answer your question though, OP, you need to declare a boolean in the player’s object (personally, I’d call the field “donator” or something of the sort) and then whenever you go to load up your shop check if the player is a donator. If not, don’t open the shop, just give him some nice little message telling him he’s not a donator. Simple as that.[/quote]

Why woudn’t an integer work? (You could have different ranks in donations) Anyway is it possible assign true or false to a variable in Java?(In declaration)

Read full topic

item.title: I need donator only shop codes!
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“mage4life271, post:1, topic:374853”]hey? how do i make one shop donators? so olny donators can get in!!!

btw its 317 server codes i need…

ty for your help…[/quote]If you don’t even know how to use boolean expressions, you should probably go ahead and navigate here and brush up on your reading.

[quote=“Dastan_, post:9, topic:374853”][quote author=mage4life271 link=topic=470817.msg3443002#msg3443002 date=1293199905]
hey? how do i make one shop donators? so olny donators can get in!!!

btw its 317 server codes i need…

ty for your help…

[/quote]

&& donator == 1){[/quote]Why would you use an integer for a value that can only have the values true or false?

To answer your question though, OP, you need to declare a boolean in the player’s object (personally, I’d call the field “donator” or something of the sort) and then whenever you go to load up your shop check if the player is a donator. If not, don’t open the shop, just give him some nice little message telling him he’s not a donator. Simple as that.
